intro: Fimbristylis amblyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spikerush, is a small perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist to waterlogged soils. Its grass-like appearance is characterized by slender, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. Fimbristylis amblyphylla plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
